page.title: 06LANDSCAPE NEAR NEWQUAY
page.content: By the side of the road, in the hedge, there are a lot of wildflowers and insects.Some of the dominant types of plant are foxglove and cowparsley.The hedgerows are not cut too regularly so preserving an abundance of plant and animal life.The roads are not very busy and there are barely any houses or buildings in or near{RIALTON BARTON and there is much rough grazing land. At{TREWASSICK}the barns are being developed and repaired.Some cottages which are Duchy property are being bought by people who would rather live in the countryside than the town. Although they would be about 2 miles from Newquay they would not see many cars or people on the road even in the holiday season.
